greVocab.Abate {uh-bayt}: (v) to reduce in amount, degree or severity.
greVocab.synonyms: ebb, lapse, let up, moderate, relent, slacken, subside, wane

greVocab.Abdicate {aab-duh-kayt}: (v) to give up a position, right or power.

greVocab.Aberrant {uh-ber-unt}: (adj) deviating from what is normal or expected.
greVocab.synonyms: abnormal, anomalous, deviant, divergent, errant, irregular
forswear, recall, recant, retract, take back

greVocab.Abstain {uhb-stayn}: (v) to choose not to do something.

greVocab.Accretion {uh-kree-shuhn}: (n) a growth in size, an increase in amount.
